result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert T. Neal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert T. Neal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert T. Neal was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May transfer probation to Racine
2 days sentence credit if revoked

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. **
May not have contact with victim unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  2 days credit if revoked.  May transfer probation to Racine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert T. Neal

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

9:43 AM 
Defendant Robert T. Neal in court.
Attorney Rosa Delgado in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance. 
Defendant waived counsel and entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1-Battery-Dom. Abuse;
Found guilty by the court; Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion. 
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions;
2 days sentence credit if revoked.
May transfer probation to Racine.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Appeal rights given.
